item.title: 特朗普称美国钢铁公司将继续留在美国，并与日本结成 "伙伴关系
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周五宣布，美国钢铁公司和日本新日铁公司已同意建立 "有计划的伙伴关系"，这意味着美国钢铁公司将继续留在美国，总部设在匹兹堡。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday announced that U.S. Steel and Japan's Nippon Steel had agreed to form a "planned partnership" that meant the American steel company would remain in the country, headquartered in Pittsburgh.】

item.title: 南加州爱迪生公司将支付 8,250 万美元解决 2020 年山猫大火损失索赔问题
item.description: 爱迪生国际公司（Edison International）旗下的南加州爱迪生公司（SCE）周五同意支付 8250 万美元，与美国林务局就 2020 年山猫大火造成的费用和损失达成和解。【原文：Southern California Edison (SCE), a unit of utility Edison International , agreed on Friday to pay $82.5 million to settle claims with the U.S. Forest Service for costs and damages resulting from the Bobcat Fire in 2020.】

item.title: 亚马逊网站因涉嫌销售受污染大米而被起诉
item.description: 亚马逊网站周五被消费者起诉，指控其销售的各种大米受到砷和其他 "重金属 "的污染。【原文：Amazon.com was sued on Friday by consumers over its alleged sale of a wide variety of rice contaminated by arsenic and other "heavy metals."】

item.title: 美国司法部与波音公司达成协议，允许飞机制造商免于起诉
item.description: 美国司法部周五表示，已与波音公司原则上达成协议，允许波音公司在两起造成 346 人死亡的 737 MAX 飞机坠毁事故引发的欺诈案中免于起诉。【原文：The U.S. Justice Department said on Friday it has struck a deal in principle with Boeing to allow it to avoid prosecution in a fraud case stemming from two fatal 737 MAX plane crashes that killed 346 people.】

item.title: 特朗普称对苹果征收的关税也将适用于三星
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周五表示，他将对苹果公司征收的 25% 关税也将适用于三星和其他智能手机制造商。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump said on Friday that a 25% tariff he says he will impose on Apple will also apply to Samsung and other smartphone makers.】

item.title: 特朗普寻求快速颁发新的核许可证，全面改革监管机构
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周五下令美国独立的核监管委员会减少监管，快速审批反应堆和发电厂的新许可证，力求将多年的审批过程缩短至 18 个月。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump ordered the nation's independent nuclear regulatory commission to cut down on regulations and fast-track new licenses for reactors and power plants on Friday, seeking to shrink a multi-year process down to 18 months.】

item.title: 欧盟反垄断监管机构调查市场力量，维萨和万事达卡收费调查范围扩大
item.description: 根据路透社看到的一份欧盟委员会文件，欧盟反垄断监管机构扩大了对威士卡和万事达卡收费的调查范围，因为他们正在寻求终端供应商和支付公司的反馈，这些反馈可能会导致反竞争行为的指控。【原文：EU antitrust regulators have widened their investigation into Visa and Mastercard's fees as they seek feedback from terminal providers and payments companies that could lead to charges of anti-competitive practices, according to a European Commission document seen by Reuters.】

item.title: 据英国《金融时报》报道，甲骨文将为 OpenAI 的美国数据中心购买 400 亿美元的英伟达芯片
item.description: 据英国《金融时报》周五报道，甲骨文公司将斥资约 400 亿美元购买英伟达（Nvidia）的高性能芯片，为 OpenAI 在美国新建的数据中心提供动力。【原文：Oracle will spend around $40 billion on Nvidia's higher-performance chips to power OpenAI's new U.S. data center, the Financial Times reported on Friday.】

item.title: 小螺丝钉 "是美国制造 iPhone 的众多障碍之一
item.description: 专家周五表示，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普希望将苹果公司的 iPhone 生产基地迁至美国的计划面临着许多法律和经济方面的挑战，其中最主要的挑战是需要自动插入的 "小螺丝钉"。【原文：President Donald Trump's bid to bring manufacturing of Apple's iPhone to the United States faces many legal and economic challenges, experts said on Friday, the least of which are the insertion of "little screws" that would need to be automated.】

item.title: 欧盟最易受特朗普新关税影响的出口产品
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周五再次威胁要加强贸易战，建议从6月1日起对欧盟商品征收50%的关税，这使得欧洲股市暴跌。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday once again threatened to ramp up his trade war, recommending a 50% tariff on European Union goods starting June 1, sending European stocks tumbling.】

item.title: 创纪录的牛肉价格提高了阵亡将士纪念日野餐的成本
item.description: 上个月，美国食品杂货店的牛肉价格创下历史新高，经济学家预计，随着夏季烧烤季节需求的增加，牛肉价格将进一步攀升。【原文：Beef prices set records last month at U.S. grocery stores, and economists expect they will climb further as demand increases during the summer grilling season that traditionally begins with cookouts on Memorial Day on Monday.】

item.title: 贝莱德称煤炭竞争案危及美国能源独立
item.description: 全球最大的资产管理公司贝莱德（BlackRock）周五表示，美国政府支持一起 "毫无根据 "的案件，指控资产管理公司合谋减少煤炭行业的竞争，这有可能破坏其能源独立的目标。【原文：U.S. government support for a "baseless" case alleging asset managers conspired to reduce competition in the coal sector risks undermining its goal of energy independence, BlackRock , the world's biggest asset manager, said on Friday.】

item.title: 税收法案即将提交参议院，投资者认为美国赤字前景恶化
item.description: 投资者担心，当一项全面的税收和支出法案在参议院获得通过时，对美国债务高山的预测可能会进一步增加，债券收益率有可能在更长时间内保持较高水平。【原文：Investors are fearing that projections for the U.S. debt mountain could increase further when a sweeping tax and spending bill goes through the Senate, with the risk that bond yields stay higher for longer.】

item.title: 因债务问题和收益率上升，美国股票基金每周面临资金外流
item.description: 在截至5月21日的一周里，美国股票基金资金大量流出，因为人们担心唐纳德-特朗普总统提出的减税法案一旦获得国会通过，会使美国债务增加数万亿美元，导致国债收益率飙升。【原文：U.S. equity funds saw huge outflows in the week ended May 21, as Treasury yields surged on fears President Donald Trump’s proposed tax-cut bill could add trillions to U.S. debt if passed by Congress.】

item.title: 特朗普助手称，必须继续对中国实施 EUV 光刻机限制措施
item.description: 白宫人工智能和加密沙皇大卫-萨克斯（David Sacks）周五表示，限制向中国出售极紫外（EUV）光刻设备是美国在半导体领域 "最重要的一项出口管制措施"。【原文：Restricting the sale of extreme ultraviolet (EUV) lithography equipment to China is the "single most important export control" the United States has in the area of semiconductors, the White House's AI and crypto czar David Sacks said on Friday.】

item.title: 特朗普紧张局势加剧，哈佛大学部分债券触及历史新低
item.description: 哈佛大学的债券是这所常春藤盟校 82 亿美元债务的一部分，周五在与美国总统唐纳德-特朗普政府日益激烈的对峙中陷入困境。【原文：Harvard University's bonds, which are part of the Ivy League school's $8.2 billion debt pile, struggled on Friday amid an increasingly fraught standoff with U.S. President Donald Trump's administration.】

item.title: 阿迪达斯警告消费者数据泄露
item.description: 德国运动服制造商阿迪达斯周五表示，一家未经授权的外部机构通过第三方客户服务提供商获取了某些消费者数据，但不包括密码或信用卡数据。【原文：German sportswear maker Adidas said on Friday an unauthorised external party had obtained certain consumer data through a third-party customer service provider albeit not passwords or credit card data.】

item.title: 美联储库克四月市场波动将有助于完善金融稳定性评估
item.description: 美联储理事丽莎-库克（Lisa Cook）周五指出，上个月由特朗普政府宣布的出人意料的高关税所引发的金融市场波动并没有导致 COVID-19 大流行病所引发的那种美国市场功能失调，但她补充说，这次经历将有助于 "磨练我们对 "金融体系稳定性的 "持续评估"。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook on Friday noted financial market volatility last month driven by the Trump administration's announcement of unexpectedly high tariffs did not result in the kind of U.S. market dysfunction triggered by the COVID-19 pandemic, but added that the experience would help "hone our ongoing assessment" of the stability of the financial system.】

item.title: 摩根大通扩充技术团队，四名资深银行家分别来自美国银行、高盛和拉扎德银行
item.description: 根据路透社看到的一份给员工的备忘录，摩根大通正在扩大投资银行的技术团队，从高盛、美国银行和拉扎德公司招聘了四名西海岸员工。【原文：JPMorgan is expanding its technology team in the investment bank with four West Coast hires from Goldman Sachs, Bank of America and Lazard, according to a memo to staff seen by Reuters.】

item.title: 埃克森公司和赫斯公司将就雪佛龙公司的油田财富交易展开对峙
item.description: 美国顶级石油生产商埃克森美孚公司和赫斯公司将于周一在法庭听证会上面对面会谈，以决定雪佛龙公司以 530 亿美元收购赫斯公司以及圭亚那多产油田宝贵股份的交易的命运。【原文：Top U.S. oil producer Exxon Mobil and Hess will meet face-to-face on Monday in a court hearing to determine the fate of Chevron's $53 billion deal to buy Hess and with it a prized stake in Guyana's prolific oilfields.】

item.title: 贝森特说特朗普的关税威胁可能会在欧盟贸易谈判中点燃一把火
item.description: 美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）周五表示，唐纳德-特朗普总统并不认为欧盟向美国提出的贸易提议质量足够高，他希望 6 月 1 日的 50%关税威胁能在欧盟与华盛顿的谈判中 "点燃一把火"。【原文：Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said on Friday that President Donald Trump does not believe that the European Union's trade offers to the United States are of sufficient quality and that he hopes that a June 1 50% tariff threat will "light a fire under the EU" in negotiations with Washington.】

item.title: 美国参议员敦促司法部不要让波音公司逃避刑事起诉
item.description: 两名美国参议员周五呼吁司法部在两起致命的 737 MAX 坠毁事故引发的刑事欺诈案中起诉波音公司，并拒绝接受允许该飞机制造商避免认罪的临时协议。【原文：Two U.S. senators called on the Justice Department on Friday to prosecute Boeing in a criminal fraud case stemming from two fatal 737 MAX crashes and reject a tentative deal to allow the planemaker to avoid pleading guilty.】

item.title: 对特朗普威胁对欧盟商品征收 50%关税的反应
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周五再次威胁要加强贸易战，建议从6月1日起对欧盟商品征收50%的关税，并警告苹果公司，他可能会对在美国以外生产的任何iPhone手机征收25%的关税。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump threatened once again on Friday to ramp up his trade war, recommending a 50% tariff on European Union goods starting June 1 and warning Apple he may impose a 25% tariff on any iPhones manufactured outside the U.S.】

item.title: 全球股票基金创六周来最大单周流出量
item.description: 穆迪（Moody）下调美国主权信用评级后，美国国债收益率上升，市场对美国债务负担和减税立法的担忧与日俱增，受此压力，全球股票基金六周来首次出现周度资金外流。【原文：Global equity funds have seen weekly outflows for the first time in six weeks, pressured by rising U.S. Treasury yields and mounting concerns over the U.S. debt burden and tax-cut legislation, following Moody’s downgrade of the U.S. sovereign credit rating.】

item.title: 美国 4 月新屋销售意外增长
item.description: 由于建筑商降低价格以吸引购房者，4 月份美国新建独户住宅的销量意外增长，但抵押贷款利率的上升和经济前景的不确定性仍然制约着房地产市场。【原文：Sales of new U.S. single-family homes unexpectedly increased in April as builders lowered prices to lure buyers, but rising mortgage rates and an uncertain economic outlook remain constraints for the housing market.】

item.title: 欧盟等待特朗普50%关税威胁的澄清
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周五建议从6月1日起对欧盟进口商品征收50%的关税后，欧盟委员会寻求美国的澄清。【原文：The European Commission sought clarity from the United States after U.S. President Donald Trump recommended on Friday putting a 50% tariff on EU imports from June 1, with Brussels' and Washington's trade chiefs due to talk later.】

item.title: 彭博新闻社报道：维萨卡和万事达卡面临欧盟反垄断挑战
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周五报道，欧盟反垄断机构正在审查支付处理巨头威士（Visa）和万事达（Mastercard）收取的费用。【原文：European Union antitrust authorities are scrutinizing fees charged by payments processing giants Visa and Mastercard , Bloomberg News reported on Friday.】

item.title: JBS 小股东批准在美国和巴西两地上市
item.description: 巴西肉类加工企业 JBS 周五在提交的一份证券文件中表示，该公司获得了股东的支持，将继续推进计划已久的股票在美国和巴西两地上市的计划。【原文：Brazilian meatpacker JBS on Friday secured shareholder support to move ahead with a long-planned dual listing of shares in both the United States and Brazil, it said in a securities filing.】

item.title: 特朗普关税冲击欧洲奢侈品行业，股价下跌
item.description: 由于美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）表示，他建议从 6 月 1 日起对来自欧盟的商品直接征收 50%的关税，欧洲奢侈品股周五下跌。【原文：European luxury shares tanked on Friday as U.S. President Donald Trump said he is recommending a straight 50% tariff on goods from the European Union starting on June 1.】

item.title: 德国维权组织阻止 Meta 将数据用于人工智能的申请失败
item.description: 周五，一个德国消费者权益组织未能赢得法院禁令，阻止 Meta Platforms 利用 Facebook 和 Instagram 用户帖子训练其人工智能模型。【原文：A German consumer rights group on Friday failed to win a court injunction to stop Meta Platforms from training its artificial intelligence models with Facebook and Instagram user posts.】
